metals.showImplicitArguments.markdownDescription: When this option is enabled, for each method that has implicit arguments they are displayed as additional decorations.

metals.showImplicitConversionsAndClasses.markdownDescription: When this option is enabled, each implicit method and class is displayed as additional decorations at the usage site.

metals.javaHome.markdownDescription:
Optional path to the Java home directory. Requires reloading the window.

Defaults to the most recent Java version between 8 and 17 (inclusive) computed by the `locate-java-home` npm package.

metals.sbtScript.markdownDescription:
Optional absolute path to an `sbt` executable to use for running `sbt bloopInstall`.

By default, Metals uses `java -jar sbt-launch.jar` with an embedded launcher while respecting `.jvmopts` and `.sbtopts`.

Update this setting if your `sbt` script requires more customizations like using environment variables.

metals.millScript.markdownDescription:
Optional absolute path to a `mill` executable to use for running `mill mill.contrib.Bloop/install`.

By default, Metals uses an embedded `millw` script while respecting `.mill-version` file.

Update this setting if your `mill` script requires more customizations.

metals.mavenScript.markdownDescription:
Optional absolute path to a `mvn` executable to use for running `mvn ch.epfl.scala:maven-bloop_2.10:<bloop_version>:bloopInstall`.

By default, Metals uses an embedded `mvnw` script.

Update this setting if your `mvn` script requires more customizations.

metals.gradleScript.markdownDescription:
Optional absolute path to a `gradle` executable to use for running `gradle bloopInstall`.

By default, Metals uses an embedded `gradlew` script.

Update this setting if your `gradle` script requires more customizations.

metals.scalafmtConfigPath.markdownDescription:
Optional custom path to the .scalafmt.conf file.

Should be an absolute path and use forward slashes `/` for file separators (even on Windows).

metals.scalafixConfigPath.markdownDescription:
Optional custom path to the .scalafix.conf file.

Should be an absolute path and use forward slashes `/` for file separators (even on Windows).

metals.scalafixRulesDependencies.markdownDescription: List of Scalafix rules dependencies in case they are not available by default in Metals and running scalafix fails due to 'rule not found' exception. For example: `com.github.liancheng::organize-imports:0.6.0` which follows the [coursier](https://get-coursier.io/) convention.

metals.bloopVersion.markdownDescription: This version will be used for the Bloop build tool plugin, for any supported build tool,while importing in Metals as well as for running the embedded server

metals.bloopJvmProperties.markdownDescription:
Optional list of JVM properties to pass along to the Bloop server. Each property needs to be a separate item.

Example: `-Xmx1G` or `-Xms100M`

metals.bloopSbtAlreadyInstalled.markdownDescription: If true, Metals will not generate a `project/metals.sbt` file under the assumption that sbt-bloop is already manually installed in the sbt build. Build import will fail with a 'not valid command bloopInstall' error in case Bloop is not manually installed in the build when using this option.

metals.customRepositories.markdownDescription:
Optional list of custom resolvers passed to Coursier when fetching metals dependencies.

For documentation on accepted values see the [Coursier documentation](https://get-coursier.io/docs/other-repositories).

The extension will pass these to Coursier using the COURSIER_REPOSITORIES environment variable after joining the custom repositories with a pipe character (|).

metals.superMethodLensesEnabled.description: Enable/disable goto super method code lens.

metals.enableStripMarginOnTypeFormatting.markdownDescription: When enabled, if you press the return key from the first line of a multiline string containing a pipe, it will automatically add `.stripMargin`.

metals.enableIndentOnPaste.markdownDescription: When this option is enabled, when user pastes any snippet into a Scala file, Metals will try to adjust the indentation to that of the current cursor.

metals.enableSemanticHighlighting.markdownDescription: When this option is enabled, Metals will provide semantic tokens for clients that support it. The feature is still experimental and does not work for all sources.

metals.testUserInterface.markdownDescription: Specifies which UI should be used for tests. `Code lenses` shows virtual text above test class, just like it was previously. `Test explorer` is a new option which shows gutter icons on the left of the file in a less intrusive way. Moreover, this option comes with a new panel called `Testing` which lists all test suites in your codebase and allows you to browse tests and navigate to the file which contains them.

metals.fallbackScalaVersion.markdownDescription:
The Scala compiler version that is used as the default or fallback in case a file doesn't belong to any build target or the specified Scala version isn't supported by Metals.

This applies to standalone Scala files, worksheets, and Ammonite scripts.

 The `automatic` value means that the Scala version for these files will be inferred from the highest supported Scala version in your projects build definition

metals.javaFormat.eclipseConfigPath.markdownDescription:
Optional custom path to the eclipse-formatter.xml file.

Should be an absolute path and use forward slashes `/` for file separators (even on Windows).

metals.javaFormat.eclipseProfile.markdownDescription: Optional Eclipse format profile to use.

metals.scalaCliLauncher.markdownDescription: Optional path to Scala CLI launcher to use.

metals.suggestLatestUpgrade.markdownDescription: Once in a day, notify if there are new server releases (including snapshots)

swift.path.markdownDescription: The path of the folder containing the Swift executables. The default is to look in the PATH environment variable.

swift.buildArguments.markdownDescription: Arguments to pass to `swift build`. Keys and values should be provided as separate entries. If you have created a copy of the build task in `tasks.json` then these build arguments will not be propogated to that task.

swift.testEnvironmentVariables.markdownDescription: Environment variables to set when running tests. To set environment variables when debugging an application you should edit the relevant `launch.json` configuration

swift.sanitizer.description: Runtime sanitizer instrumentation. Requires a re-compilation.

swift.searchSubfoldersForPackages.markdownDescription: Search sub-folders of workspace folder for Swift Packages at start up.

swift.autoGenerateLaunchConfigurations.markdownDescription: When loading a `Package.swift`, auto-generate `launch.json` configurations for running any executables.

swift.disableAutoResolve.markdownDescription: Disable automatic running of `swift package resolve`.

swift.problemMatchCompileErrors.description: List compile errors in the Problems View.

swift.excludePathsFromPackageDependencie.description: A list of paths to exclude from the Package Dependencies view.

swift.backgroundCompilation.markdownDescription: **Experimental**: Run `swift build` in the background whenever a file is saved.

swift.buildPath.markdownDescription: Path to the build directory passed to all swift package manager commands.

swift.sourcekit-lsp.serverPath.markdownDescription: The path of the `sourcekit-lsp` executable. The default is to look in the path where `swift` is found.

swift.sourcekit-lsp.serverArguments.description: Arguments to pass to Sourcekit-LSP. Argument keys and values should be provided as separate entries in the array e.g. ['--log-level', 'debug']

swift.sourcekit-lsp.supported-languages.description: List of languages supported by SourceKit-LSP. This is used to determine whether SourceKit-LSP should provide language features for a particular file type.

swift.sourcekit-lsp.trace.server.description: Traces the communication between VS Code and the SourceKit-LSP language server.

sourcekit-lsp.serverPath.markdownDescription: The path of the `sourcekit-lsp` executable. The default is to look in the path where `swift` is found.

sourcekit-lsp.serverArguments.description: Arguments to pass to Sourcekit-LSP. Argument keys and values should be provided as separate entries in the array e.g. ['--log-level', 'debug']

sourcekit-lsp.inlayHints.enabled.description: Render inlay type annotations in the editor. Inlay hints require Swift 5.6.

enumDescriptions: Always enable
Always disable
Disable when C/C++ extension is active
sourcekit-lsp.support-c-cpp.description: Add LSP functionality for C/C++ files. By default this is set to disable when the C/C++ extension is active.

sourcekit-lsp.trace.server.description: Traces the communication between VS Code and the SourceKit-LSP language server.

swift.coverage.displayReportAfterRun.description: Should test coverage report be shown after running tests

swift.coverage.alwaysShowStatusItem.description: Always show the test coverage status item. If this is set to true the status item can be clicked on to toggle test coverage display on and off.

swift.coverage.colors.lightMode.hit.description: Light mode theme background color for line of code hit during test coverage.

swift.coverage.colors.lightMode.miss.description: Light mode theme background color for line of code missed during test coverage.

swift.coverage.colors.darkMode.hit.description: Dark mode theme background color for line of code hit during test coverage.

swift.coverage.colors.darkMode.miss.description: Dark mode theme background color for line of code missed during test coverage.

swift.swiftEnvironmentVariables.markdownDescription: Additional environment variables to pass to swift operations.

swift.runtimePath.description: The path of the folder containing the Swift runtime libraries.

swift.SDK.description: The path of the SDK to compile against (`--sdk` parameter). The default SDK is determined by the environment on macOS and Windows.

swift.diagnostics.description: Output additional diagnostics to the Swift Output View.

Lua.addonManager.enable.markdownDescription: Whether the addon manager is enabled or not.

Lua.completion.autoRequire.markdownDescription: When the input looks like a file name, automatically `require` this file.

Lua.completion.displayContext.markdownDescription: Previewing the relevant code snippet of the suggestion may help you understand the usage of the suggestion. The number set indicates the number of intercepted lines in the code fragment. If it is set to `0`, this feature can be disabled.

Lua.completion.postfix.markdownDescription: The symbol used to trigger the postfix suggestion.

Lua.completion.showParams.markdownDescription: Display parameters in completion list. When the function has multiple definitions, they will be displayed separately.

markdownEnumDescriptions: Always show context words in suggestions.
Contextual words are only displayed when suggestions based on semantics cannot be provided.

Lua.completion.workspaceWord.markdownDescription: Whether the displayed context word contains the content of other files in the workspace.

Lua.diagnostics.disable.markdownDescription: Disabled diagnostic (Use code in hover brackets).

Lua.diagnostics.disableScheme.markdownDescription: Do not diagnose Lua files that use the following scheme.

Lua.diagnostics.groupFileStatus.markdownDescription:
Modify the diagnostic needed file status in a group.

* Opened:  only diagnose opened files
* Any:     diagnose all files
* None:    disable this diagnostic

`Fallback` means that diagnostics in this group are controlled by `diagnostics.neededFileStatus` separately.
Other settings will override individual settings without end of `!`.

markdownEnumDescriptions: Only when these files are opened will it be diagnosed.

Lua.diagnostics.libraryFiles.markdownDescription: How to diagnose files loaded via `Lua.workspace.library`.
markdownEnumDescriptions: Only when these files are opened will it be diagnosed.

Lua.diagnostics.neededFileStatus.markdownDescription:
* Opened:  only diagnose opened files
* Any:     diagnose all files
* None:    disable this diagnostic

End with `!` means override the group setting `diagnostics.groupFileStatus`.

ambiguity-1.description: Enable ambiguous operator precedence diagnostics. For example, the `num or 0 + 1` expression will be suggested `(num or 0) + 1` instead.

assign-type-mismatch.description: Enable diagnostics for assignments in which the value's type does not match the type of the assigned variable.

await-in-sync.description: Enable diagnostics for calls of asynchronous functions within a synchronous function.

cast-local-type.description: Enable diagnostics for casts of local variables where the target type does not match the defined type.

cast-type-mismatch.description: Enable diagnostics for casts where the target type does not match the initial type.

close-non-object.description: Enable diagnostics for attempts to close a variable with a non-object.

code-after-break.description: Enable diagnostics for code placed after a break statement in a loop.

codestyle-check.description: Enable diagnostics for incorrectly styled lines.

count-down-loop.description: Enable diagnostics for `for` loops which will never reach their max/limit because the loop is incrementing instead of decrementing.

deprecated.description: Enable diagnostics to highlight deprecated API.

different-requires.description: Enable diagnostics for files which are required by two different paths.

discard-returns.description: Enable diagnostics for calls of functions annotated with `---@nodiscard` where the return values are ignored.

doc-field-no-class.description: Enable diagnostics to highlight a field annotation without a defining class annotation.

duplicate-doc-alias.description: Enable diagnostics for a duplicated alias annotation name.

duplicate-doc-field.description: Enable diagnostics for a duplicated field annotation name.

duplicate-doc-param.description: Enable diagnostics for a duplicated param annotation name.

duplicate-set-field.description: Enable diagnostics for setting the same field in a class more than once.

global-element.description: Enable diagnostics to warn about global elements.

global-in-nil-env.description: Enable cannot use global variables （ `_ENV` is set to `nil`） diagnostics.

invisible.description: Enable diagnostics for accesses to fields which are invisible.

lowercase-global.description: Enable lowercase global variable definition diagnostics.

missing-global-doc.description: Missing annotations for globals! Global functions must have a comment and annotations for all parameters and return values.

missing-local-export-doc.description: Missing annotations for exported locals! Exported local functions must have a comment and annotations for all parameters and return values.

missing-parameter.description: Enable diagnostics for function calls where the number of arguments is less than the number of annotated function parameters.

missing-return.description: Enable diagnostics for functions with return annotations which have no return statement.

missing-return-value.description: Enable diagnostics for return statements without values although the containing function declares returns.

need-check-nil.description: Enable diagnostics for variable usages if `nil` or an optional (potentially `nil`) value was assigned to the variable before.

newfield-call.description: Enable newfield call diagnostics. It is raised when the parenthesis of a function call appear on the following line when defining a field in a table.

newline-call.description: Enable newline call diagnostics. Is's raised when a line starting with `(` is encountered, which is syntactically parsed as a function call on the previous line.

no-unknown.description: Enable diagnostics for cases in which the type cannot be inferred.

not-yieldable.description: Enable diagnostics for calls to `coroutine.yield()` when it is not permitted.

param-type-mismatch.description: Enable diagnostics for function calls where the type of a provided parameter does not match the type of the annotated function definition.

redundant-return.description: Enable diagnostics for return statements which are not needed because the function would exit on its own.

redundant-return-value.description: Enable diagnostics for return statements which return an extra value which is not specified by a return annotation.

redundant-value.description: Enable the redundant values assigned diagnostics. It's raised during assignment operation, when the number of values is higher than the number of objects being assigned.

return-type-mismatch.description: Enable diagnostics for return values whose type does not match the type declared in the corresponding return annotation.

spell-check.description: Enable diagnostics for typos in strings.

unbalanced-assignments.description: Enable diagnostics on multiple assignments if not all variables obtain a value (e.g., `local x,y = 1`).

undefined-doc-class.description: Enable diagnostics for class annotations in which an undefined class is referenced.

undefined-doc-name.description: Enable diagnostics for type annotations referencing an undefined type or alias.

undefined-doc-param.description: Enable diagnostics for cases in which a parameter annotation is given without declaring the parameter in the function definition.

undefined-env-child.description: Enable undefined environment variable diagnostics. It's raised when `_ENV` table is set to a new literal table, but the used global variable is no longer present in the global environment.

undefined-field.description: Enable diagnostics for cases in which an undefined field of a variable is read.

unknown-cast-variable.description: Enable diagnostics for casts of undefined variables.

unknown-diag-code.description: Enable diagnostics in cases in which an unknown diagnostics code is entered.

Lua.diagnostics.neededFileStatus.title: neededFileStatus

End with `!` means override the group setting `diagnostics.groupSeverity`.

Lua.diagnostics.severity.title: severity

Lua.diagnostics.unusedLocalExclude.markdownDescription: Do not diagnose `unused-local` when the variable name matches the following pattern.

Lua.diagnostics.workspaceEvent.markdownDescription: Set the time to trigger workspace diagnostics.
markdownEnumDescriptions: Trigger workspace diagnostics when the file is changed.
Trigger workspace diagnostics when the file is saved.

Lua.diagnostics.workspaceRate.markdownDescription: Workspace diagnostics run rate (%). Decreasing this value reduces CPU usage, but also reduces the speed of workspace diagnostics. The diagnosis of the file you are currently editing is always done at full speed and is not affected by this setting.

Lua.doc.packageName.markdownDescription: Treat specific field names as package, e.g. `m_*` means `XXX.m_id` and `XXX.m_type` are package, witch can only be accessed in the file where the definition is located.

Lua.doc.privateName.markdownDescription: Treat specific field names as private, e.g. `m_*` means `XXX.m_id` and `XXX.m_type` are private, witch can only be accessed in the class where the definition is located.

Lua.doc.protectedName.markdownDescription: Treat specific field names as protected, e.g. `m_*` means `XXX.m_id` and `XXX.m_type` are protected, witch can only be accessed in the class where the definition is located and its subclasses.

Lua.format.defaultConfig.markdownDescription:
The default format configuration. Has a lower priority than `.editorconfig` file in the workspace.
Read [formatter docs](https://github.com/CppCXY/EmmyLuaCodeStyle/tree/master/docs) to learn usage.
Lua.format.defaultConfig.title: defaultConfig

Lua.hint.arrayIndex.markdownDescription: Show hints of array index when constructing a table.
markdownEnumDescriptions: Show hints only when the table is greater than 3 items, or the table is a mixed table.

Lua.hint.await.markdownDescription: If the called function is marked `---@async`, prompt `await` at the call.

Lua.hint.paramName.markdownDescription: Show hints of parameter name at the function call.
markdownEnumDescriptions: All types of parameters are shown.
Only literal type parameters are shown.

Lua.hint.paramType.markdownDescription: Show type hints at the parameter of the function.

Lua.hint.semicolon.markdownDescription: If there is no semicolon at the end of the statement, display a virtual semicolon.
markdownEnumDescriptions: When two statements are on the same line, display a semicolon between them.

Lua.hint.setType.markdownDescription: Show hints of type at assignment operation.

Lua.hover.enumsLimit.markdownDescription: When the value corresponds to multiple types, limit the number of types displaying.

Lua.hover.expandAlias.markdownDescription: Whether to expand the alias. For example, expands `---@alias myType boolean|number` appears as `boolean|number`, otherwise it appears as `myType'.

Lua.hover.previewFields.markdownDescription: When hovering to view a table, limits the maximum number of previews for fields.

Lua.hover.viewNumber.markdownDescription: Hover to view numeric content (only if literal is not decimal).

Lua.hover.viewString.markdownDescription: Hover to view the contents of a string (only if the literal contains an escape character).

Lua.hover.viewStringMax.markdownDescription: The maximum length of a hover to view the contents of a string.

Lua.misc.executablePath.markdownDescription: Specify the executable path in VSCode.

Lua.misc.parameters.markdownDescription: [Command line parameters](https://github.com/LuaLS/lua-telemetry-server/tree/master/method) when starting the language server in VSCode.

Lua.runtime.builtin.markdownDescription:
Adjust the enabled state of the built-in library. You can disable (or redefine) the non-existent library according to the actual runtime environment.

* `default`: Indicates that the library will be enabled or disabled according to the runtime version
* `enable`: always enable
* `disable`: always disable
Lua.runtime.builtin.title: builtin

Lua.runtime.fileEncoding.markdownDescription: File encoding. The `ansi` option is only available under the `Windows` platform.

Lua.runtime.meta.markdownDescription: Format of the directory name of the meta files.

Lua.runtime.nonstandardSymbol.markdownDescription: Supports non-standard symbols. Make sure that your runtime environment supports these symbols.

Lua.runtime.path.markdownDescription:
When using `require`, how to find the file based on the input name.
Setting this config to `?/init.lua` means that when you enter `require 'myfile'`, `${workspace}/myfile/init.lua` will be searched from the loaded files.
if `runtime.pathStrict` is `false`, `${workspace}/**/myfile/init.lua` will also be searched.
If you want to load files outside the workspace, you need to set `Lua.workspace.library` first.

Lua.runtime.pathStrict.markdownDescription: When enabled, `runtime.path` will only search the first level of directories, see the description of `runtime.path`.

Lua.runtime.plugin.markdownDescription: Plugin path. Please read [wiki](https://luals.github.io/wiki/plugins) to learn more.

Lua.runtime.special.markdownDescription:
The custom global variables are regarded as some special built-in variables, and the language server will provide special support
The following example shows that 'include' is treated as' require '.
```json
"Lua.runtime.special" : {
    "include" : "require"
}
```
Lua.runtime.special.title: special

Lua.semantic.enable.markdownDescription: Enable semantic color. You may need to set `editor.semanticHighlighting.enabled` to `true` to take effect.

Lua.semantic.keyword.markdownDescription: Semantic coloring of keywords/literals/operators. You only need to enable this feature if your editor cannot do syntax coloring.

Lua.type.castNumberToInteger.markdownDescription: Allowed to assign the `number` type to the `integer` type.

Lua.type.weakNilCheck.markdownDescription:
When checking the type of union type, ignore the `nil` in it.

When this setting is `false`, the `number|nil` type cannot be assigned to the `number` type. It can be with `true`.

Lua.type.weakUnionCheck.markdownDescription:
Once one subtype of a union type meets the condition, the union type also meets the condition.

When this setting is `false`, the `number|boolean` type cannot be assigned to the `number` type. It can be with `true`.

Lua.typeFormat.config.markdownDescription: Configures the formatting behavior while typing Lua code.

auto_complete_end.description: Controls if `end` is automatically completed at suitable positions.

auto_complete_table_sep.description: Controls if a separator is automatically appended at the end of a table declaration.

format_line.description: Controls if a line is formatted at all.

Lua.typeFormat.config.title: config

Lua.window.progressBar.markdownDescription: Show progress bar in status bar.

Lua.window.statusBar.markdownDescription: Show extension status in status bar.

Lua.workspace.checkThirdParty.markdownDescription:
Automatic detection and adaptation of third-party libraries, currently supported libraries are:

* OpenResty
* Cocos4.0
* LÖVE
* LÖVR
* skynet
* Jass

Lua.workspace.library.markdownDescription: In addition to the current workspace, which directories will load files from. The files in these directories will be treated as externally provided code libraries, and some features (such as renaming fields) will not modify these files.

Lua.workspace.preloadFileSize.markdownDescription: Skip files larger than this value (KB) when preloading.

Lua.workspace.userThirdParty.markdownDescription: Add private third-party library configuration file paths here, please refer to the built-in [configuration file path](https://github.com/LuaLS/lua-language-server/tree/master/meta/3rd)

svelte.enable-ts-plugin.title: Enable TypeScript Svelte plugin
svelte.enable-ts-plugin.description: Enables a TypeScript plugin which provides intellisense for Svelte files inside TS/JS files.

svelte.ask-to-enable-ts-plugin.title: Ask to enable TypeScript Svelte plugin
svelte.ask-to-enable-ts-plugin.description: Ask on startup to enable the TypeScript plugin.

svelte.language-server.runtime.title: Language Server Runtime
svelte.language-server.runtime.description: - You normally don't need this - Path to the node executable to use to spawn the language server. This is useful when you depend on native modules such as node-sass as without this they will run in the context of vscode, meaning node version mismatch is likely. Minimum required node version is 12.17. This setting can only be changed in user settings for security reasons.

svelte.language-server.ls-path.title: Language Server Path
svelte.language-server.ls-path.description: - You normally don't set this - Path to the language server executable. If you installed the "svelte-language-server" npm package, it's within there at "bin/server.js". Path can be either relative to your workspace root or absolute. Set this only if you want to use a custom version of the language server. This will then also use the workspace version of TypeScript. This setting can only be changed in user settings for security reasons.

svelte.language-server.port.title: Language Server Port
svelte.language-server.port.description: - You normally don't set this - At which port to spawn the language server. Can be used for attaching to the process for debugging / profiling. If you experience crashes due to "port already in use", try setting the port. -1 = default port is used.

svelte.language-server.debug.title: Language Server Debug Mode
svelte.language-server.debug.description: - You normally don't set this - Enable more verbose logging for the language server useful for debugging language server execution.

svelte.trace.server.description: Traces the communication between VS Code and the Svelte Language Server.

svelte.ui.svelteKitFilesContextMenu.enab.description: Show a context menu to generate SvelteKit files. "always" to always show it. "never" to always disable it. "auto" to show it when in a SvelteKit project.

svelte.plugin.typescript.signatureHelp.e.title: TypeScript: Signature Help
svelte.plugin.typescript.signatureHelp.e.description: Enable signature help (parameter hints) for TypeScript

svelte.plugin.typescript.semanticTokens..title: TypeScript: Semantic Tokens
svelte.plugin.typescript.semanticTokens..description: Enable semantic tokens (semantic highlight) for TypeScript.

svelte.plugin.css.globals.title: CSS: Global Files
svelte.plugin.css.globals.description: Which css files should be checked for global variables (`--global-var: value;`). These variables are added to the css completions. String of comma-separated file paths or globs relative to workspace root.

svelte.plugin.css.completions.emmet.title: CSS: Include Emmet Completions
svelte.plugin.css.completions.emmet.description: Enable emmet auto completions for CSS

svelte.plugin.html.completions.emmet.title: HTML: Include Emmet Completions
svelte.plugin.html.completions.emmet.description: Enable emmet auto completions for HTML

svelte.plugin.svelte.compilerWarnings.title: Svelte: Compiler Warnings Settings
svelte.plugin.svelte.compilerWarnings.description: Svelte compiler warning codes to ignore or to treat as errors. Example: { 'css-unused-selector': 'ignore', 'unused-export-let': 'error'}

svelte.plugin.svelte.format.enable.title: Svelte: Format
svelte.plugin.svelte.format.enable.description: Enable formatting for Svelte (includes css & js). You can set some formatting options through this extension. They will be ignored if there's any kind of configuration file, for example a `.prettierrc` file.

svelte.plugin.svelte.format.config.svelt.title: Svelte Format: Sort Order
svelte.plugin.svelte.format.config.svelt.description: Format: join the keys `options`, `scripts`, `markup`, `styles` with a - in the order you want. This option is ignored if there's any kind of configuration file, for example a `.prettierrc` file.

svelte.plugin.svelte.format.config.svelt.title: Svelte Format: Strict Mode
svelte.plugin.svelte.format.config.svelt.description: More strict HTML syntax. This option is ignored if there's any kind of configuration file, for example a `.prettierrc` file.

svelte.plugin.svelte.format.config.svelt.title: Svelte Format: Allow Shorthand
svelte.plugin.svelte.format.config.svelt.description: Option to enable/disable component attribute shorthand if attribute name and expression are the same. This option is ignored if there's any kind of configuration file, for example a `.prettierrc` file.

svelte.plugin.svelte.format.config.svelt.title: Svelte Format: Bracket New Line
svelte.plugin.svelte.format.config.svelt.description: Put the `>` of a multiline element on a new line. This option is ignored if there's any kind of configuration file, for example a `.prettierrc` file.

svelte.plugin.svelte.format.config.svelt.title: Svelte Format: Indent Script And Style
svelte.plugin.svelte.format.config.svelt.description: Whether or not to indent code inside `<script>` and `<style>` tags. This option is ignored if there's any kind of configuration file, for example a `.prettierrc` file.

svelte.plugin.svelte.format.config.print.title: Svelte Format: Print Width
svelte.plugin.svelte.format.config.print.description: Maximum line width after which code is tried to be broken up. This is a Prettier core option. If you have the Prettier extension installed, this option is ignored and the corresponding option of that extension is used instead. This option is also ignored if there's any kind of configuration file, for example a `.prettierrc` file.

svelte.plugin.svelte.format.config.singl.title: Svelte Format: Quotes
svelte.plugin.svelte.format.config.singl.description: Use single quotes instead of double quotes, where possible. This is a Prettier core option. If you have the Prettier extension installed, this option is ignored and the corresponding option of that extension is used instead. This option is also ignored if there's any kind of configuration file, for example a `.prettierrc` file.

svelte.plugin.svelte.defaultScriptLangua.title: Svelte: Default Script Language
svelte.plugin.svelte.defaultScriptLangua.description: The default language to use when generating new script tags

evenBetterToml.taplo.bundled.description: Use the bundled taplo language server. If set to `false`, the `taplo` executable must be found in PATH or must be set in `evenBetterToml.taplo.path`.

evenBetterToml.taplo.path.description: An absolute path to the `taplo` executable. `evenBetterToml.taplo.bundled` needs to be set to `false` for this to have any effect.

evenBetterToml.taplo.extraArgs.description: Additional arguments for Taplo. Has no effect for the bundled LSP.

evenBetterToml.taplo.configFile.path.description: An absolute, or workspace relative path to the Taplo configuration file.

evenBetterToml.taplo.configFile.enabled.description: Whether to enable the usage of a Taplo configuration file.

evenBetterToml.semanticTokens.description: Enable semantic tokens for inline table and array keys.

evenBetterToml.schema.enabled.description: Enable completion and validation based on JSON schemas.

evenBetterToml.schema.links.description: Whether to show clickable links for keys in the editor.

evenBetterToml.schema.catalogs.description: A list of URLs to schema catalogs where schemas and associations can be fetched from

evenBetterToml.schema.associations.markdownDescription:
Additional document and schema associations. 

 The key must be a regular expression, this pattern is used to associate schemas with absolute document URIs. Overlapping patterns result in undefined behaviour and either matching schema can be used. 

 The value must be an absolute URI to the JSON schema, for supported values and more information [read here](https://taplo.tamasfe.dev/configuration#visual-studio-code).

evenBetterToml.schema.cache.memoryExpira.description: The amount of seconds after which schemas will be invalidated from memory.
evenBetterToml.schema.cache.memoryExpira.markdownDescription:
The amount of seconds after which schemas will be invalidated from memory. 
**NOTE**: setting too low values will cause performance issues and validation of some schemas will fail.

evenBetterToml.schema.cache.diskExpirati.description: The amount of seconds after which cached catalogs and schemas expire and will be attempted to be fetched again.

evenBetterToml.completion.maxKeys.description: The maximum amount of keys in a dotted key to display during completion, 0 effectively disables key completions.

evenBetterToml.syntax.semanticTokens.description: Whether to enable semantic tokens for tables and arrays.

evenBetterToml.formatter.alignEntries.description: Align entries vertically. Entries that have table headers, comments, or blank lines between them are not aligned.

evenBetterToml.formatter.alignComments.description: Align consecutive comments after entries and items vertically. This applies to comments that are after entries or array items

evenBetterToml.formatter.arrayTrailingCo.description: Put trailing commas for multiline arrays.

evenBetterToml.formatter.arrayAutoExpand.description: Automatically expand arrays to multiple lines.

evenBetterToml.formatter.inlineTableExpa.description: Expand values inside in line tables.

evenBetterToml.formatter.arrayAutoCollap.description: Automatically collapse arrays if they fit in one line.

evenBetterToml.formatter.compactArrays.description: Omit whitespace padding inside single-line arrays.

evenBetterToml.formatter.compactInlineTa.description: Omit whitespace padding inside inline tables.

evenBetterToml.formatter.columnWidth.description: Target maximum column width after which arrays are expanded into new lines.

evenBetterToml.formatter.indentTables.description: Indent subtables if they come in order.

evenBetterToml.formatter.indentString.description: Indentation to use, should be tabs or spaces but technically could be anything.

evenBetterToml.formatter.trailingNewline.description: Add trailing newline to the source.

evenBetterToml.formatter.reorderKeys.description: Alphabetically reorder keys that are not separated by blank lines.

evenBetterToml.formatter.reorderArrays.description: Alphabetically reorder array values that are not separated by blank lines.

evenBetterToml.formatter.allowedBlankLin.description: The maximum amount of consecutive blank lines allowed.

evenBetterToml.rules.description: Array of Taplo rules in JSON format, see https://taplo.tamasfe.dev/configuration/file.html#rules. The rules given here are appended to existing rules from config files, if any. There is no conversion done, all object keys must be snake_case, including formatting rules.

mdx.experimentalLanguageServer.description: Enable experimental IntelliSense support for MDX files.

errorLens.enabled.description: Controls all decorations and features (except commands).

errorLens.enabledInMergeConflict.markdownDescription: Controls if decorations are shown if the editor has git merge conflict indicators `<<<<<<<` or `=======` or `>>>>>>>`.

errorLens.fontWeight.markdownDescription: Font weight of inline message. `"normal"` is alias for 400, `"bold"` is alias for 700).

errorLens.fontStyleItalic.description: When enabled - shows inline message in italic font style.

errorLens.margin.markdownDescription: Distance between the last word on the line and the start of inline message ([CSS units](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/length)).

errorLens.padding.markdownDescription: Padding of the inline message. Visible when `#errorLens.messageBackgroundMode#` is set to "message".

errorLens.borderRadius.markdownDescription: Border radius of the inline message. Visible when `#errorLens.messageBackgroundMode#` is set to "message".

errorLens.enabledDiagnosticLevels.description: Customize which diagnostic levels(severity) to highlight.

errorLens.messageTemplate.markdownDescription:
Template used for all inline messages. Whitespace between items is important.

List of variables:

- `$message` - diagnostic message text

- `$count` - Number of diagnostics on the line

- `$severity` - Severity prefix taken from `#errorLens.severityText#`

- `$source` - Source of diagnostic e.g. "eslint"

- `$code` - Code of the diagnostic

errorLens.messageMaxChars.markdownDescription: Cut off inline message if it's longer than this value. (Improves performance when the diagnostic message is long). Set to **0** to disable inline message.

errorLens.annotationPrefix.markdownDescription: Specify diagnostic message prefixes (when `#errorLens.addAnnotationTextPrefixes#` is enabled). For example, emoji: ❗ ⚠ ℹ.

errorLens.addAnnotationTextPrefixes.markdownDescription: When enabled - prepends diagnostic severity ('ERROR:', 'WARNING:' etc) to the message. (Prefixes can be configured with `annotationPrefix` setting).

errorLens.addNumberOfDiagnostics.markdownDescription: When enabled - prepends number of diagnostics on the line. Like: `[1/2]`.

errorLens.messageEnabled.description: Controls whether inline message is shown or not (Including background highlight).

enumDescriptions: The entire line is highlighted.
Inline message is highlighted.
Message is not highlighted (only has foreground colors).
errorLens.messageBackgroundMode.description: Controls how inline message is highlighted in the editor (entire line / only message / none).

errorLens.editorHoverPartsEnabled.markdownDescription: Controls which parts of the editor hover tooltip to show.

errorLens.statusBarIconsEnabled.markdownDescription: When enabled - shows highlighted error/warning icons in status bar.

errorLens.statusBarIconsPriority.markdownDescription: Move status bar icons left or right by adjasting the number priority.

errorLens.statusBarIconsAlignment.markdownDescription: Choose on which side the icons status bar is on: left or right.

errorLens.statusBarIconsUseBackground.markdownDescription: When enabled - highlights status bar icons with background, when disabled - with foreground.

errorLens.statusBarIconsAtZero.markdownDescription: What to do when there are 0 errors/warnings - hide the item or strip its background color.

errorLens.statusBarMessageEnabled.markdownDescription: When enabled - shows message in status bar.

errorLens.statusBarMessagePriority.markdownDescription: Move status bar message left or right by adjasting the number priority.

errorLens.statusBarMessageAlignment.markdownDescription: Choose on which side the message status bar is on: left or right.

errorLens.statusBarColorsEnabled.markdownDescription: When enabled - use message decoration foreground as color of Status Bar text.

errorLens.statusBarMessageType.markdownDescription: Pick what to show in Status Bar: closest message or only message for the active line.
enumDescriptions: Show closest to the cursor diagnostic.
Show closest to the cursor diagnostic (sorted by severity e.g. error will be shown before warning even if it's farther from the cursor).
Show only diagnostic that is on the same line as the cursor.

errorLens.statusBarCommand.markdownDescription: Pick command that activates on click for Status Bar.

errorLens.statusBarMessageTemplate.markdownDescription:
Template for status bar message. Whitespace between items is important.

List of variables:

- `$message` - diagnostic message text

- `$count` - Number of diagnostics on the line

- `$severity` - Severity prefix taken from `#errorLens.severityText#`

- `$source` - Source of diagnostic e.g. "eslint"

- `$code` - Code of the diagnostic

matcher.description: The RegExp pattern against which to match diagnostic messages

message.description: The entire replacement for messages matching matcher. Can reference match groups like $0 (entire expression), $1 (first capture group), etc.

errorLens.replace.markdownDescription: Specify message to transform. E.g. if this is configured to [{ matcher: 'foo (.*)', message: 'just $1' }], the message 'foo bar' would be displayed as 'just bar'.

errorLens.exclude.markdownDescription: Specify messages that should not be highlighted (RegExp). Strings passed to the RegExp constructor: `new RegExp(EXCLUDE_ITEM, 'i');`

errorLens.excludeBySource.markdownDescription: Specify source or source(code) pair that should not be highlighted. Examples: `["eslint"]` or `["eslint(padded-blocks)"]`

errorLens.excludePatterns.markdownDescription: Exclude files by using glob pattern. Example `["**/*.{ts,js}"]`

errorLens.disableLineComments.markdownDescription:
Used for `errorLens.disableLine` command that adds a comment disabling linter rule for a line.
To force comment on the same line - add `SAME_LINE` to the message: `"eslint": "// eslint-disable-line $code SAME_LINE"`

errorLens.lintFilePaths.markdownDescription: Specify where to search for linter rule definitions by diagnostic source ([glob](https://code.visualstudio.com/api/references/vscode-api#GlobPattern) for local linter files). `node_modules` folder is excluded.

errorLens.searchForProblemQuery.markdownDescription: Pick query to open in default browser when searching for problem with `errorLens.searchForProblem` command.

enumDescriptions: Show closest to the cursor diagnostic.
Show closest to the cursor diagnostic (sorted by severity e.g. error will be shown before warning even if it's farther from the cursor).
Show only diagnostic that is on the same line as the cursor.
errorLens.selectProblemType.markdownDescription: Which problem to select (closest / active line) when executing `errorLens.selectProblem` command.

errorLens.light.markdownDescription: Specify color of decorations for when the light color theme is active.

errorGutterIconPath.description: Absolute path to error gutter icon for light themes.

warningGutterIconPath.description: Absolute path to warning gutter icon for light themes.

infoGutterIconPath.description: Absolute path to info gutter icon for light themes.

hintGutterIconPath.description: Absolute path to hint gutter icon for light themes.

errorGutterIconColor.markdownDescription: Error color of simple gutter icons (shapes and letters) for light themes.

warningGutterIconColor.markdownDescription: Warning color of simple gutter icons (shapes and letters) for light themes.

infoGutterIconColor.markdownDescription: Info color of simple gutter icons (shapes and letters) for light themes.

hintGutterIconColor.markdownDescription: Hint color of simple gutter icons (shapes and letters) for light themes.

errorLens.delay.markdownDescription: Delay (ms) before showing problem decorations (**0** to disable). Minimum delay of **500** is enforced by the extension. `#errorLens.delayMode#` controls how to handle the delay.

markdownEnumDescriptions: New problems appear according to `errorLens.delay` setting. Fixed problems disappear faster. A bit buggy.
Decorations for problems are debounced according to `errorLens.delay` setting.
errorLens.delayMode.markdownDescription: Pick which version of the delay to use.

errorLens.onSave.description: When enabled - updates decorations only on document save (manual).

errorLens.onSaveTimeout.description: Time period (ms) that used for showing decorations after the document save.

errorLens.enableOnDiffView.markdownDescription: Enable decorations when viewing a diff view in the editor (e.g. Git diff).

enumDescriptions: Highlight all problems in file
Highlight all problems in file (except the line at the cursor)
Highlight only the problem at the cursor
Highlight only closest to the cursor problem
errorLens.followCursor.description: Highlight only portion of the problems.

errorLens.followCursorMore.markdownDescription:
Augments `#errorLens.followCursor#`.
Adds number of lines to top and bottom when `#errorLens.followCursor#` is set to `activeLine`.
 Adds number of closest problems when `#errorLens.followCursor#` is `closestProblem`

errorLens.gutterIconsEnabled.description: When enabled - shows gutter icons (In place of the debug breakpoint icon).

errorLens.gutterIconsFollowCursorOverrid.markdownDescription: When enabled and `#errorLens.followCursor#` setting is not `allLines`, then gutter icons would be rendered for all problems. But line decorations (background, message) only for active line.

enumDescriptions: Similar to vscode icons in Problems Panel (old).
Similar to vscode icons in Problems Panel (new).
Similar to vscode icons in Problems Panel, only without a border.
Simple filled circle.
Simple filled square.
Simple filled square with rounded corners.
Simple one letter icon (E,W,I,H).

errorLens.errorGutterIconPath.description: Absolute path to error gutter icon.

errorLens.warningGutterIconPath.description: Absolute path to warning gutter icon.

errorLens.infoGutterIconPath.description: Absolute path to info gutter icon.

errorLens.hintGutterIconPath.description: Absolute path to hint gutter icon.

errorLens.errorGutterIconColor.markdownDescription: Error color of simple gutter icons (shapes and letters).

errorLens.warningGutterIconColor.markdownDescription: Warning color of simple gutter icons (shapes and letters).

errorLens.infoGutterIconColor.markdownDescription: Info color of simple gutter icons (shapes and letters).

errorLens.hintGutterIconColor.markdownDescription: Hint color of simple gutter icons (shapes and letters).

errorLens.removeLinebreaks.markdownDescription: When enabled - replaces line breaks in inline diagnostic message with whitespaces.

errorLens.replaceLinebreaksSymbol.markdownDescription: Symbol to replace linebreaks. Requires enabling `#errorLens.removeLinebreaks#`.

errorLens.scrollbarHackEnabled.markdownDescription: When enabled - prevents showing horizontal scrollbar in editor (caused by inline decorations).

lldb.consoleMode.description: Controls whether the debug console input is by default treated as debugger commands or as expressions to evaluate.
enumDescriptions: Treat debug console input as debugger commands.  In order to evaluate an expression, prefix it with '?' (question mark).
Treat debug console input as expressions.  In order to execute a debugger command, prefix it with '`' (backtick).
(experimental) Use the debug console for warningevaluation of expressions, open a separate terminal for input of LLDB commands.

lldb.evaluationTimeout.description: Timeout for expression evaluation, in seconds.

lldb.displayFormat.description: Default format for displayed variable values.

lldb.dereferencePointers.description: Whether to show summaries of the pointees instead of numeric values of the pointers themselves.

enumDescriptions: Only when source is not available.
Never show.
Always show, even if source is available.

lldb.suppressMissingSourceFiles.description: Suppress VSCode's messages about missing source files (when debug info refers to files not available on the local machine).

lldb.dbgconfig.description: Common user-defined settings that can be inserted into launch configurations using ${dbgconfig:name} syntax.

lldb.launch.initCommands.markdownDescription: Commands executed *before* initCommands in individual launch configurations.

lldb.launch.preRunCommands.markdownDescription: Commands executed *before* preRunCommands in individual launch configurations.

lldb.launch.postRunCommands.markdownDescription: Commands executed *before* postRunCommands in individual launch configurations.

lldb.launch.exitCommands.markdownDescription: Commands executed *after* exitCommands in individual launch configurations.

lldb.launch.env.description: Additional environment variables merged with 'env' individual launch configurations.

lldb.launch.envFile.description: File to read the environment variables from.

enumDescriptions: Use integrated terminal in VSCode.
Use external terminal window.
Use VScode Debug Console for stdout and stderr. Stdin will be unavailable.

lldb.launch.stdio.description: Default destination for stdio streams: null = send to debugger console or a terminal, "<path>" = attach to a file/tty/fifo.

lldb.launch.expressions.description: The default evaluator type used for expressions.

lldb.launch.sourceMap.description: Additional entries that will be merged with 'sourceMap's of individual launch configurations.

lldb.launch.breakpointMode.description: Specifies how source breakpoints should be set.
enumDescriptions: Resolve locations using full source file path.
Resolve locations using file name only.

lldb.launch.sourceLanguages.description: A list of source languages to enable language-specific features for.

lldb.launch.relativePathBase.description: Default base directory used for resolution of relative source paths.  Defaults to "${workspaceFolder}".

lldb.rpcServer.description: Start an RPC server that will accept debug configuration requests.

lldb.library.markdownDescription:
Which LLDB library to use.

This can be either a file path (recommended) or a directory, in which case platform-specific heuristics will be used to locate the actual library file.

lldb.cargo.markdownDescription: Name of the command to invoke as Cargo.

lldb.adapterEnv.description: Extra environment variables for the debug adapter.

lldb.reproducer.markdownDescription:
Enable capture of a [reproducer](https://lldb.llvm.org/design/reproducers.html).
May also contain a path of the directory to save the reproducer in.

lldb.terminalPromptClear.description: A sequence of strings sent to the terminal in order to clear its command prompt.

lldb.evaluateForHovers.description: Enable value preview when cursor is hovering over a variable.

lldb.commandCompletions.description: Enable command completions in debug console.

swift-coverage.coverageFilePattern.description: The pattern where to find the llvm-codecov JSON-reports.

swift-coverage.highlightsCoveredText.description: Wether code with coverage should have a higlighted background.

swift-coverage.highlightsNotCoveredText.description: Wether code with no coverage should have a higlighted background.

swift-coverage.coveredTextBackground.dar.description: The brackground color used to highlight code with coverage.

swift-coverage.coveredTextBackground.lig.description: The brackground color used to highlight code with coverage.

swift-coverage.notCoveredTextBackground..description: The brackground color used to highlight code with no coverage.
The brackground color used to highlight code with no coverage.

swift-coverage.highlightsCoveredGutter.description: Wether lines with coverage should have a highlight-gutter.

swift-coverage.highlightsNotCoveredGutte.description: Wether lines with no coverage should have a highlight-gutter.

swift-coverage.highlightsMixedGutter.description: Wether lines with mixed coverage should have a highlight-gutter.

swift-coverage.coveredGutterIcon.dark.description: The path to the gutter-icon used to highlight code with coverage.

swift-coverage.coveredGutterIcon.light.description: The path to the gutter-icon used to highlight code with coverage.

swift-coverage.notCoveredGutterIcon.dark.description: The path to the gutter-icon used to highlight code without coverage.

swift-coverage.notCoveredGutterIcon.ligh.description: The path to the gutter-icon used to highlight code without coverage.

swift-coverage.mixedGutterIcon.dark.description: The path to the gutter-icon used to highlight code with mixed coverage.

swift-coverage.mixedGutterIcon.light.description: The path to the gutter-icon used to highlight code with mixed coverage.

vim.normalModeKeyBindings.markdownDescription: Remapped keys in Normal mode. Allows mapping to Vim commands or VS Code actions. See [README](https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim/#key-remapping) for details.

vim.normalModeKeyBindingsNonRecursive.markdownDescription: Non-recursive remapped keys in Normal mode. Allows mapping to Vim commands or VS Code actions. See [README](https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim/#key-remapping) for details.

vim.operatorPendingModeKeyBindings.markdownDescription: Remapped keys in OperatorPending mode. Allows mapping to Vim commands or VS Code actions. See [README](https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim/#key-remapping) for details.

vim.operatorPendingModeKeyBindingsNonRec.markdownDescription: Non-recursive remapped keys in OperatorPending mode. Allows mapping to Vim commands or VS Code actions. See [README](https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim/#key-remapping) for details.

vim.useCtrlKeys.markdownDescription: Enable some Vim Ctrl key commands that override otherwise common operations, like `Ctrl+C`.

vim.leader.markdownDescription: What key should `<leader>` map to in remappings?

vim.searchHighlightColor.markdownDescription: Background color of non-current search matches. The color must not be opaque so as not to hide underlying decorations. Uses `#editor.findMatchHighlightColor#` from current theme if undefined.

vim.searchHighlightTextColor.markdownDescription: Foreground color of non-current search matches.

vim.searchMatchColor.markdownDescription: Background color of the current match. Uses `#editor.findMatchColor#` from current theme if undefined.

vim.searchMatchTextColor.markdownDescription: Foreground color of the current match.

vim.substitutionColor.markdownDescription: Background color of substituted text when `#editor.inccommand#` is enabled. Uses `#editor.findMatchColor#` from current theme if undefined.

vim.substitutionTextColor.markdownDescription: Foreground color of substituted text when `#editor.inccommand#` is enabled.

vim.highlightedyank.color.description: Background color of yanked text. The color must not be opaque so as not to hide underlying decorations.

vim.highlightedyank.duration.description: Duration in milliseconds of the yank highlight.

vim.useSystemClipboard.description: Use system clipboard for unnamed register.

vim.overrideCopy.description: Override VS Code's copy command with our own copy command, which works better with VSCodeVim. Turn this off if copying is not working.

vim.insertModeKeyBindings.markdownDescription: Remapped keys in Insert mode. Allows mapping to Vim commands or VS Code actions. See [README](https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim/#key-remapping) for details.

vim.insertModeKeyBindingsNonRecursive.markdownDescription: Non-recursive keybinding overrides to use for Insert mode. Allows mapping to Vim commands or VS Code actions. See [README](https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim/#key-remapping) for details.

vim.visualModeKeyBindings.markdownDescription: Remapped keys in Visual mode. Allows mapping to Vim commands or VS Code actions. See [README](https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim/#key-remapping) for details.

vim.visualModeKeyBindingsNonRecursive.markdownDescription: Non-recursive keybinding overrides to use for Visual mode. Allows mapping to Vim commands or VS Code actions. See [README](https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim/#key-remapping) for details.

vim.commandLineModeKeyBindings.markdownDescription: Remapped keys in command line mode. Allows mapping to Vim commands or VS Code actions. See [README](https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim/#key-remapping) for details.

vim.commandLineModeKeyBindingsNonRecursi.markdownDescription: Non-recursive keybinding overrides to use for command line mode. Allows mapping to Vim commands or VS Code actions. See [README](https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim/#key-remapping) for details.

vim.textwidth.markdownDescription: Width to word-wrap to when using `gq`.

vim.timeout.description: Timeout in milliseconds for remapped commands.

vim.maxmapdepth.description: Maximum number of times a mapping is done without resulting in a character to be used.

vim.scroll.markdownDescription: Number of lines to scroll with `Ctrl-U` and `Ctrl-D` commands. Set to 0 to use a half page scroll.

vim.showcmd.description: Show the text of any command you are in the middle of writing.

vim.showmodename.description: Show the name of the current mode in the statusbar.

vim.iskeyword.markdownDescription: Keywords contain alphanumeric characters and '_'. If not configured, `#editor.wordSeparators#` is used.

vim.smartcase.markdownDescription: Override the `ignorecase` option if the search pattern contains upper case characters.

vim.matchpairs.markdownDescription: Characters that form pairs. The % command jumps from one to the other. Only character pairs are allowed that are different, thus you cannot jump between two double quotes. The characters must be separated by a colon. The pairs must be separated by a comma.

vim.easymotionMarkerBackgroundColor.description: Set a custom background color for EasyMotion markers.

vim.easymotionMarkerForegroundColorOneCh.description: Set a custom color for the text on one character long markers.

vim.easymotionMarkerForegroundColorTwoCh.description: Set a custom color for the first character on two character long markers.
Set a custom color for the second character on two character long markers.

vim.easymotionIncSearchForegroundColor.markdownDescription: Set a custom color for the easymotion search n-character (default `<leader><leader>/`).

vim.easymotionDimColor.markdownDescription: Set a custom color for the easymotion dimmed characters when `#vim.easymotionDimBackground#` is set to true.

vim.easymotionDimBackground.description: Whether to dim other text while markers are visible.

vim.easymotionMarkerFontWeight.description: Set the font weight of the marker text.

vim.easymotionKeys.description: Set the characters used for jump marker name.

vim.smartRelativeLine.markdownDescription: `#editor.lineNumbers#` is determined by the active Vim mode, absolute when in insert mode, relative otherwise.

vim.targets.bracketObjects.enable.markdownDescription: Enable last/next movements for bracket objects.

vim.targets.smartQuotes.enable.markdownDescription: Enable the smart quotes movements from [targets.vim](https://github.com/wellle/targets.vim#quote-text-objects).

vim.targets.smartQuotes.breakThroughLine.markdownDescription: Whether to break through lines when using [n]ext/[l]ast motion, see [targets.vim#next-and-last-quote](https://github.com/wellle/targets.vim#next-and-last-quote).

vim.targets.smartQuotes.aIncludesSurroun.markdownDescription: Whether to use default Vim behavior when using `a` (e.g. `da'`) which include surrounding spaces, or not, as for other text objects.

vim.sneakUseIgnorecaseAndSmartcase.markdownDescription: Case sensitivity is determined by `#vim.ignorecase#` and `#vim.smartcase#`.

vim.sneakReplacesF.markdownDescription: Use single-character [Sneak](https://github.com/justinmk/vim-sneak) instead of Vim's native `f`.

vim.argumentObjectSeparators.markdownDescription: Set separators for the argument text object.

vim.argumentObjectOpeningDelimiters.markdownDescription: Set opening delimiters for the argument text object.

vim.argumentObjectClosingDelimiters.markdownDescription: Set closing delimiters for the argument text object.

vim.hlsearch.description: Show all matches of the most recent search pattern.

vim.inccommand.markdownDescription: Show the effects of the `:substitute` command as you type.
enumDescriptions: Don't show substitutions
Show substitutions after matched text
Replace matched text with substitutions

vim.incsearch.markdownDescription: Show where a `/` or `?` search matches as you type it.

vim.history.description: How much search or command history should be remembered.

vim.joinspaces.description: Add two spaces after '.', '?', and '!' when joining or reformatting.

vim.handleKeys.description: Delegate certain key combinations back to VSCode to be handled natively.

vim.statusBarColorControl.markdownDescription: Allow VSCodeVim to change status bar color based on mode. **NOTE:** Using this feature will have a negative impact on performance.

vim.statusBarColors.normal.description: Status bar color when in Normal mode.

vim.statusBarColors.insert.description: Status bar color when in Insert mode.

vim.statusBarColors.visual.description: Status bar color when in Visual mode.

vim.statusBarColors.visualline.description: Status bar color when in VisualLine mode.

vim.statusBarColors.visualblock.description: Status bar color when in VisualBlock mode.

vim.statusBarColors.replace.description: Status bar color when in Replace mode.

vim.statusBarColors.commandlineinprogres.description: Status bar color when in CommandLineInProgress mode.

vim.statusBarColors.searchinprogressmode.description: Status bar color when in SearchInProgress mode.

vim.statusBarColors.easymotionmode.description: Status bar color when in EasyMotion mode.

vim.statusBarColors.easymotioninputmode.description: Status bar color when in EasyMotionInput mode.

vim.statusBarColors.surroundinputmode.description: Status bar color when in SurroundInput mode.

vim.visualstar.markdownDescription: In Visual mode, start a search with `*` or `#` using the current selection.

vim.changeWordIncludesWhitespace.description: Includes trailing whitespace when changing word.

vim.foldfix.description: Uses a hack to move around folds properly.

vim.mouseSelectionGoesIntoVisualMode.description: If enabled, dragging with the mouse activates Visual mode.

vim.disableExtension.description: Disables the VSCodeVim extension. The extension will continue to be loaded and activated, but Vim functionality will be disabled.

vim.enableNeovim.markdownDescription: Use Neovim to execute Ex commands. You should restart VS Code after enabling/disabling this for the changes to take effect. **NOTE:** Neovim version 0.2.0 or greater must be installed, and if the executable is not on your PATH, `#vim.neovimPath#` must be set.

vim.neovimPath.markdownDescription: Path to Neovim executable. For example, `/usr/bin/nvim`, or  `C:\Program Files\Neovim\bin\nvim.exe`.

vim.neovimUseConfigFile.markdownDescription: Use a config file for Neovim, specified by `vim.neovimConfigPath`.

vim.neovimConfigPath.markdownDescription: Path to Neovim configuration file. `vim.neovimUseConfigFile` must be enabled. If path is left blank, Neovim will use its default config path, i.e. `~/.config/nvim/init.vim` or 'C:\Users\USERNAME\AppData\Local\nvim\init.vim'.

vim.vimrc.enable.markdownDescription: Use key mappings from a `.vimrc` file.

vim.vimrc.path.markdownDescription: Path to a Vim configuration file. If unset, it will check for `$HOME/.vscodevimrc`, `$HOME/.vimrc`, `$HOME/_vimrc`, and `$HOME/.config/nvim/init.vim`, in that order.

vim.substituteGlobalFlag.markdownDescription: Automatically apply the global flag, `/g`, to substitute commands. When set to true, use `/g` to mean only first match should be replaced.

vim.gdefault.markdownDescription: Automatically apply the global flag, `/g`, to substitute commands. When set to true, use `/g` to mean only first match should be replaced.

vim.autoSwitchInputMethod.enable.description: If enabled, the input method switches automatically when the mode changes.

vim.autoSwitchInputMethod.defaultIM.markdownDescription: The input method for your normal mode, find more information [here](https://github.com/VSCodeVim/Vim#input-method).

vim.autoSwitchInputMethod.switchIMCmd.description: The shell command to switch input method.

vim.autoSwitchInputMethod.obtainIMCmd.description: The shell command to get current input method.

vim.whichwrap.description: Comma-separated list of motion keys that should wrap to next/previous line.

vim.report.description: Threshold for reporting number of lines changed.

vim.digraphs.description: Custom digraph shortcuts for inserting special characters, expressed as UTF16 code points.

vim.wrapscan.description: Searches wrap around the end of the file.

vim.startofline.markdownDescription: When `true` the commands listed below move the cursor to the first non-blank of the line.  When `false` the cursor is kept in the same column (if possible).  This applies to the commands: `<C-d>`, `<C-u>`, `<C-b>`, `<C-f>`, `G`, `H`, `M`, `L`, `gg`, and to the commands `d`, `<<` and `>>` with a linewise operator.

vim.showMarksInGutter.description: Show the currently set mark(s) in the gutter.

vim.shell.description: Path to the shell to use for `!` and `:!` commands.

d.servedPath.description: Path of the serve-d executable. Path can be omitted if in $PATH or installed using code-d

d.stdlibPath.description: Array of paths to phobos and D runtime for automatic inclusion for auto completion

d.dcdClientPath.title: DCD Client Path
d.dcdClientPath.description: Path of the dcd-client executable. Path can be omitted if in $PATH or installed using code-d

d.dcdServerPath.title: DCD Server Path
d.dcdServerPath.description: Path of the dcd-server executable. Path can be omitted if in $PATH or installed using code-d

d.dubPath.description: Path of the dub executable. Path can be omitted if in $PATH or installed using code-d

d.dmdPath.description: Path of the dmd executable. Path can be omitted if in $PATH

d.enableLinting.description: If code-d should watch for file saves and report static analysis. Might interfere with other lint plugins or settings.

d.enableSDLLinting.description: If code-d should report errors in your dub.sdl file.

d.enableDubLinting.description: If code-d should build on save to check for compile errors.

d.enableStaticLinting.description: If code-d should use DScanner to statically lint files.

d.enableAutoComplete.description: Start dcd-server at startup and complete using dcd-client.

d.enableFormatting.description: If the default formatting keybind should call dfmt on D files.

d.enableDMDImportTiming.description: Add code lenses on import statements executing a dmd instance trying to compile that import statement to get the impact on compilation time by this import.

d.enableCoverageDecoration.description: Automatically highlight tested/untested converage lines with light red/green backgrounds per line for *.lst files.

d.enableGCProfilerDecorations.description: Automatically embed code lenses for all GC allocations based on profilegc.log.

d.neverUseDub.description: If this is true then a custom workspace where you manually provide the import paths will always be used instead of dub. See d.projectImportPaths for setting import paths then. This is discouraged as it will remove most features like packages, building & compiler linting. If this is a standalone project with no external dependencies with a custom build system then this should be true.

d.projectImportPaths.description: Setting for import paths in your workspace if not using dub. This will replace other paths. Its recommended to set this in your workspace settings instead of your user settings to keep it separate for each project.

d.dubConfiguration.description: Sets the default configuration to use when starting up

d.dubArchType.description: Sets the default arch type to use when starting up

d.dubBuildType.description: Sets the default build type to use when starting up

d.dubCompiler.description: Sets the default compiler to use when starting up

d.overrideDfmtEditorconfig.description: Uses dfmt config options & vscode editor config instead of .editorconfig because of inconsistencies with the vscode editor settings.

d.aggressiveUpdate.description: Update/install outdated & missing tools without confirmation

d.argumentSnippets.description: When autocompleting functions automatically insert the signature as snippet which can be navigated using tab.

d.betaStream.deprecationMessage: This option has been replaced with "d.servedReleaseChannel":"nightly"
d.betaStream.description: Always get latest serve-d commit when starting vscode and an update is available.

enumDescriptions: Always fetch the latest pre-compiled stable release binaries from the serve-d GitHub repository
Always fetch the latest pre-compiled potentially unstable pre-release binaries from the serve-d GitHub repository
Always fetch the latest pre-compiled nightly binaries from the serve-d GitHub repository. These are being generated every night (UTC) if something changed and tests passed.
Don't do any update checks for serve-d (not recommended if you don't update serve-d outside code-d)
d.servedReleaseChannel.description: Release channel (stable, beta, nightly) to automatically download serve-d binaries from. serve-d is the D language server used with code-d and provides all language functionality except syntax highlighting, which is provided by code-d.

d.smartServedUpdates.description: Randomly omits serve-d update checks to save bandwidth, lower startup delay and minimize breakage on new releases with quick fixes. Also avoids to update when working on fridays.

d.scanAllFolders.description: Initialize an instance for every dub.sdl and dub.json file in all folders.

d.disabledRootGlobs.description: Array of globs for disabling/preventing project instances by the d.scanAllFolders setting.

d.extraRoots.description: Array of workspace-relative (or absolute) folders to force start a project instance in.

d.alwaysShowDubStatusButtons.description: Switch to always show dub Configuration/Arch Type/Build Type/Compiler buttons in dub projects and not just when a D file is open.

d.alwaysShowCoverageStatus.description: Switch to always show coverage status when available through lst files and not just when a D file is open.

enumDescriptions: Open a dialog box each time there are too many projects. (recommended for user-settings)
Never load any more projects than the d.manyProjectsThreshold setting specified. (this or "load" recommended only per-project)

Load all projects even if there are more than the d.manyProjectsThreshold setting specified. (this or "skip" recommended only per-project; never recommended for user-settings or large projects with many dub test projects)
d.manyProjectsAction.description: What to do when there are too many project roots to load from. The deepest folder paths are skipped for skip.

d.manyProjectsThreshold.description: For how many projects to start triggering the manyProjectsAction to load or not load further projects.

d.ignoreDebugHints.description: If true, no hints will be shown when a project may be wrongly configured when trying to start debugging.

enumDescriptions: D-Scanner runs on every file that is opened immediately, also for any internal cross-project or external dependencies.
D-Scanner runs on every file only in the current project that is opened immediately. It then only starts on other files when changing something.
D-Scanner never runs when opening a file and only starts running when changing something.
d.lintOnFileOpen.description: Enables dscanner linting when opening a new file.

d.dietContextCompletion.description: Enables parsing of //-context= in diet files to import local variables shared with the opened diet template.

d.generateModuleNames.description: Automatically insert/replace the module name definition in the current file when creating or renaming a file.

d.showUpdateChangelogs.description: Open CHANGELOG.md on every code-d update (which also includes serve-d updates) to see new features.

dfmt.alignSwitchStatements.description: Align labels, cases, and defaults with their enclosing switch.

enumDescriptions: Curly braces always on separate lines
Curly braces on the same line as for example if or while statements. Else on same line as closing curly brace.
Curly braces on the same line as for example if or while statements, but a new line after the closing curly brace, even if there is an else

dfmt.spaceAfterCast.description: Insert space after the closing paren of a cast expression.

dfmt.splitOperatorAtLineEnd.description: Place operators on the end of the previous line when splitting lines.

dfmt.selectiveImportSpace.description: Insert space after the module name and before the : for selective imports.

dfmt.compactLabeledStatements.description: Place labels on the same line as the labeled switch, for, foreach, or while statement.

enumDescriptions: newline only if constraint will wrap, indent constraint
newline only if constraint will wrap
always add newline
always add newline and indent the constraint
dfmt.templateConstraintStyle.description: Control the formatting of template constraints. See https://github.com/dlang-community/dfmt/issues/215

dfmt.spaceBeforeFunctionParameters.description: Insert space before the opening paren of a function parameter list.

dfmt.singleTemplateConstraintIndent.description: Set if the constraints are indented by a single tab instead of two. Has only an effect if the style set to `always_newline_indent` or `conditional_newline_indent`.

dfmt.spaceBeforeAAColon.description: Adds a space after an associative array key before the `:` like in older dfmt versions.

dfmt.keepLineBreaks.description: Keep existing line breaks if these don't violate other formatting rules.

dfmt.singleIndent.description: Set if the code in parens is indented by a single tab instead of two.

dscanner.ignoredKeys.description: DScanner warnings to ignore in this project.

workbench.editor.autoLockGroups.description: リストのいずれかの種類と一致するエディターがエディター グループの最初のものとして開いており、複数のグループが開いている場合、グループは自動的にロックされます。ロックされたグループは、ユーザーのジェスチャ (例: ドラッグ アンド ドロップ) で明示的に選択された場合に、エディターを開くときにのみ使用されますが、既定では使用されません。その結果、ロックされたグループ内のアクティブなエディターが、誤って別のエディターで置き換えられる可能性は低くなります。
